intro: Guatteria lateriflora, commonly known as the lateriflora guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Marcaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its broad, palmate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces edible berries that are often consumed by local wildlife and sometimes by humans. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
